#scb 2.13.3

head -n13899 otoos10.txt | tail -n+265 > darwin.txt
#prints lines 265-13899 of otoos10.txt to darwin.txt
grep -o -i ["evolution","evolved"] darwin.txt | wc -l
#counts the number of times evolution and evolved occur in darwin.txt
#and is case-insensitive in the search
grep -o -i ["natural selection","wallace"] darwin.txt | wc -l
#counts occurrences of "natural selection" and "wallace" in darwin.txt


#scb 2.13.4
grep "180[0-3]0101,TMAX" 180[0-3].csv
#searches for strings matching 18000101, 18010101, etc. in files
#1800.csv, 1801.csv, etc., and returns the entire line containing 
#the search string
#instead of wildcarding the files, can just type
#each file name in succession that you want to search through,
#e.g.
grep "180[0-3]0101,TMAX" 1800.csv 1801.csv 1802.csv 1803.csv

#to find warmest temp for a given day of 1800, change the specific day searched in grep.
#e.g. for February 5:
grep "18000205,TMAX" 1800.csv | cut -d',' -f4 | sort | tail -n1
#-d',' specifies the comma as the delimiter; -f4 tells it to cut the 4th field/column
#delimited by a comma
